metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0738 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
OpenStack Object Storage (Swift) before 2.3.1 (Kilo), 2.4.x, and 2.5.xbefore 2.5.1 (Liberty) do not properly close server connections, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (proxy-server resourceconsumption) via a series of interrupted requests to a Large Object URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0738` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-swift - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
swift - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
swift-account - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
swift-container - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
swift-object - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
swift-object-expirer - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
swift-proxy - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: swift package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.0-0ubuntu2').
